PP.content: text as web (toile), can dissimulate itself for centuries, regenerate its own tissue behind cutting trace
PP.linkedContent: text as web (toile), can dissimulate itself for centuries, regenerate its own tissue behind cutting trace

PP.content: histos (1. standing up of a mast, beam of loom; 2. weave 4. spider web, honeycomb of bees) of metaphor, metaphor of histos
PP.linkedContent: histos (1. standing up of a mast, beam of loom; 2. weave 4. spider web, honeycomb of bees) of metaphor, metaphor of histos

PP.content: hypothesis of a rigorous, sure, subtle form [re: Phaedrus] is more fertile, discovers new chords, surprises w/in more secret organization of themes, names, words, unties sumplokē patiently interlacing arguments > magisterial: affirms and effaces w/ suppleness, irony, discretion
PP.linkedContent: hypothesis of a rigorous, sure, subtle form [re: Phaedrus] is more fertile, discovers new chords, surprises w/in more secret organization of themes, names, words, unties sumplokē patiently interlacing arguments > magisterial: affirms and effaces w/ suppleness, irony, discretion

PP.content: what species of protection (amuntērion) is the dialectic? counter-poison that’s not antidote [?] > acc. Plato’s Stranger, 2 forms of artificial (poiein, protection), of the 2nd form: 1) antidote either human or divine 2) problēmata (shield, fence), either armaments or fences, fences (clôtures, phragmata) can be screens (alexētēria) or protections, finally garments, art of weaving: problematic space of protection
PP.linkedContent: what species of protection (amuntērion) is the dialectic? counter-poison that’s not antidote [?] > acc. Plato’s Stranger, 2 forms of artificial (poiein, protection), of the 2nd form: 1) antidote either human or divine 2) problēmata (shield, fence), either armaments or fences, fences (clôtures, phragmata) can be screens (alexētēria) or protections, finally garments, art of weaving: problematic space of protection

PP.content: [anamnesic] dialectic as antidoteness of antidote, passage btwn human & divine, before their division, also dialectic as science of sumplokē [see p. 67], art of weaving (tissage), if there are 2 sorts of texture
PP.linkedContent: [anamnesic] dialectic as antidoteness of antidote, passage btwn human & divine, before their division, also dialectic as science of sumplokē [see p. 67], art of weaving (tissage), if there are 2 sorts of texture

PP.content: [stranger (from Sophist) as first grammatologist?] grammar and dialectics can only be distinguished when truth is fully present, fills logos > but parricide in Sophist (impossibility of presence) establishes condition of discourse as diacritical principle of sumplokē ——necessity of logos as necessity of parricide > absolute pre-condition crossed out by parricide at point of its arche-being—prevents difference btwn grammar and ontology
PP.linkedContent: [stranger (from Sophist) as first grammatologist?] grammar and dialectics can only be distinguished when truth is fully present, fills logos > but parricide in Sophist (impossibility of presence) establishes condition of discourse as diacritical principle of sumplokē ——necessity of logos as necessity of parricide > absolute pre-condition crossed out by parricide at point of its arche-being—prevents difference btwn grammar and ontology

VP.content: Derrida: although there is no discourse w/out expressive kernel, we could almost say la totalité du discours est prise dans une trame indicative
VP.linkedContent: Derrida: although there is no discourse w/out expressive kernel, we could almost say la totalité du discours est prise dans une trame indicative

T.content: Being, understood as [philosophy’s] proper, assures w/out let up (sans relâche) the relevant of reappropriation, the law of its proper weave (tissu), the economy of its representation
T.linkedContent: Being, understood as [philosophy’s] proper, assures w/out let up (sans relâche) the relevant of reappropriation, the law of its proper weave (tissu), the economy of its representation

T.content: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée
T.linkedContent: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée

T.content: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo
T.linkedContent: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo

WM.content: by placing metaphor en abyme, Nietzsche is responsible for the need to find a new distinction than that btwn metaphor and concept
WM.linkedContent: by placing metaphor en abyme, Nietzsche is responsible for the need to find a new distinction than that btwn metaphor and concept

WM.content: Nietzsche takes risk of continuity btwn metaphor & concept, describes metaphorical tissue of man as spider’s web, Derrida follows web, tissu, tisser, to weave, honey bees, Marx
WM.linkedContent: Nietzsche takes risk of continuity btwn metaphor & concept, describes metaphorical tissue of man as spider’s web, Derrida follows web, tissu, tisser, to weave, honey bees, Marx

DS.content: hymenoptera, filmy membrane, uphainō (to weave, spin spider web), huphos (textile), humnos (a weave, wedding song, song of mourning), suo, suere (to sew), a little stitch (syuman), tissue on which so many bodily metaphors are written
DS.linkedContent: hymenoptera, filmy membrane, uphainō (to weave, spin spider web), huphos (textile), humnos (a weave, wedding song, song of mourning), suo, suere (to sew), a little stitch (syuman), tissue on which so many bodily metaphors are written

DS.content: hymen, comme tissu, envelops, outwits (déjoue) philosphemes, ontologies, dialectics, les retourne et les inscrit, suspense in the antre of perpenetration
DS.linkedContent: hymen, comme tissu, envelops, outwits (déjoue) philosphemes, ontologies, dialectics, les retourne et les inscrit, suspense in the antre of perpenetration

DS.content: simple opposition btwn activity & passivity (btwn all -er/-ed concepts) becomes too formally weak to encompass graphics of hymen, its spider web, the play of its eyelids
DS.linkedContent: simple opposition btwn activity & passivity (btwn all -er/-ed concepts) becomes too formally weak to encompass graphics of hymen, its spider web, the play of its eyelids

DS.content: paragraph woven like textile, copious veil, fabric being spread out before & stitched down, histological operation pierces/joins w/ point, nothing but text, cut through, gathered up
DS.linkedContent: paragraph woven like textile, copious veil, fabric being spread out before & stitched down, histological operation pierces/joins w/ point, nothing but text, cut through, gathered up

POS.content: gram as differance neutralizes phonologistic propensity of “sign,” liberates “graphic substance” > gram not an element, interwoven w/ traces of other elements of chain/system
POS.linkedContent: gram as differance neutralizes phonologistic propensity of “sign,” liberates “graphic substance” > gram not an element, interwoven w/ traces of other elements of chain/system

POS.content: this interweaving, this textile, is the text > produced only in transformation of another text
POS.linkedContent: this interweaving, this textile, is the text > produced only in transformation of another text

POS.content: gathering Derrida’s work into a “sheaf,” historic/systematic crossroads, is structural impossibility of limiting network of differance, of putting an edge on its weave, not a master-word, always finds itself in others
POS.linkedContent: gathering Derrida’s work into a “sheaf,” historic/systematic crossroads, is structural impossibility of limiting network of differance, of putting an edge on its weave, not a master-word, always finds itself in others

P.content: economize on the abyss: 1) textual art of reprise, s’épargner la chute en tissant et repliant à l’infini le tissu, multiply patches (pièces) 2) abyssal operation (formalize rules, constrain logic, reappropriate): work toward rèleve & that in it which regularly reproduces collapse
P.linkedContent: economize on the abyss: 1) textual art of reprise, s’épargner la chute en tissant et repliant à l’infini le tissu, multiply patches (pièces) 2) abyssal operation (formalize rules, constrain logic, reappropriate): work toward rèleve & that in it which regularly reproduces collapse

P.content: for Kant, system of pure philosophy (metaphysics) is not yet possible; only critique is possible, produces krinein, in-between > metaphysics sews everything up, includes critique w/in
P.linkedContent: for Kant, system of pure philosophy (metaphysics) is not yet possible; only critique is possible, produces krinein, in-between > metaphysics sews everything up, includes critique w/in

P.content: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete
P.linkedContent: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete

P.content: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente
P.linkedContent: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente

ROP.content: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel
ROP.linkedContent: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel

ROP.content: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien
ROP.linkedContent: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien

ROP.content: in Freud, weaves, knots that can’t be untangled, Geflecht (Heidegger), challenges notion of analysis as unknotting; knowing how to pull on threads, Plato’s Statesman, diaresis, the royal art (technē) of the weaver; in Goethe, “fabrication of thought”—a thousand links in one stroke (Schlag)
ROP.linkedContent: in Freud, weaves, knots that can’t be untangled, Geflecht (Heidegger), challenges notion of analysis as unknotting; knowing how to pull on threads, Plato’s Statesman, diaresis, the royal art (technē) of the weaver; in Goethe, “fabrication of thought”—a thousand links in one stroke (Schlag)

ROP.content: royal weaver of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort
ROP.linkedContent: royal weaver of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort

ROP.content: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]
ROP.linkedContent: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]

SP.content: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun

ATIA.content: in SW, Derrida analyzed how pubic fleece led Freud into fatality of theoretical delirium
ATIA.linkedContent: in SW, Derrida analyzed how pubic fleece led Freud into fatality of theoretical delirium

DIF.content: differance neither a word nor a concept, à la lettre > impossible (for essential reasons) to gather (rassembler) all usages of differance in a sheaf (en faisceau)
DIF.linkedContent: differance neither a word nor a concept, à la lettre > impossible (for essential reasons) to gather (rassembler) all usages of differance in a sheaf (en faisceau)

DIF.content: Derrida uses sheaf because it marks fact that the assemblage has structure of a weaving, interlacing (d’un intrication, d’un tissage, d’un croisement), which permits threads (lines of force/meaning) to go off again, always ready to tie (nouer) itself up w/ others
DIF.linkedContent: Derrida uses sheaf because it marks fact that the assemblage has structure of a weaving, interlacing (d’un intrication, d’un tissage, d’un croisement), which permits threads (lines of force/meaning) to go off again, always ready to tie (nouer) itself up w/ others

O.content: [re: Maldoror’s 6th song, exit into the real] spider w/out web to spin, instant of awakening, instant of death
O.linkedContent: [re: Maldoror’s 6th song, exit into the real] spider w/out web to spin, instant of awakening, instant of death

SW.content: diminish the thread—neither pretense of totality (Penelope’s ruse—don’t lose lost threads [les fils perdus], preparing a shroud) nor totality (Royal Weaver)
SW.linkedContent: diminish the thread—neither pretense of totality (Penelope’s ruse—don’t lose lost threads [les fils perdus], preparing a shroud) nor totality (Royal Weaver)

SW.content: diminishing stitch, reduce (not undo), decrescendo, “diminution” consists in saying less, letting more be understood > stitch so as to let “rhetoric appropriate the truth of the verdict”
SW.linkedContent: diminishing stitch, reduce (not undo), decrescendo, “diminution” consists in saying less, letting more be understood > stitch so as to let “rhetoric appropriate the truth of the verdict”

SW.content: all your new work is neither Testament nor Odyssey? the opposite, I call them to the witness-stand, knowing they’ll always be bigger than the tapestry I’m trying to sew them into (a crossing) pp. 313-14 diminish the infinite, diminish ad infinitum: that’s the temptation/dream since ever: but you’re doing it w/out being sure of textile to come, as if caught in sails (voiles) & pushed toward unknown, at the point of this extremity, as if someone were awaiting new Messiah, i.e. a “happy event”—nicknamed the verdict > yes, but a verdict w/out truth, w/ a due date no longer caught up in revealing a truth, the fold or unfolding of a veil—writing from distant place of as if
SW.linkedContent: all your new work is neither Testament nor Odyssey? the opposite, I call them to the witness-stand, knowing they’ll always be bigger than the tapestry I’m trying to sew them into (a crossing) pp. 313-14 diminish the infinite, diminish ad infinitum: that’s the temptation/dream since ever: but you’re doing it w/out being sure of textile to come, as if caught in sails (voiles) & pushed toward unknown, at the point of this extremity, as if someone were awaiting new Messiah, i.e. a “happy event”—nicknamed the verdict > yes, but a verdict w/out truth, w/ a due date no longer caught up in revealing a truth, the fold or unfolding of a veil—writing from distant place of as if

SW.content: Celan: scarcely has an image burst in then it remains suspended in the web: half image, half veil
SW.linkedContent: Celan: scarcely has an image burst in then it remains suspended in the web: half image, half veil

SW.content: braid of phonemes (verdict, voix, vouloir, le voir, la venue, etc.) is knotted out of sight, remains, like warp of text, untranslatable > language we inherit is never ours, which is why it can’t be translated: put it outside its self, no longer recognize its children/idiom [baby daddy]
SW.linkedContent: braid of phonemes (verdict, voix, vouloir, le voir, la venue, etc.) is knotted out of sight, remains, like warp of text, untranslatable > language we inherit is never ours, which is why it can’t be translated: put it outside its self, no longer recognize its children/idiom [baby daddy]

SW.content: for Freud, women discovered one technique, weaving (veiling), but really they just copied nature (pubic hair) > unveiled the means of veiling
SW.linkedContent: for Freud, women discovered one technique, weaving (veiling), but really they just copied nature (pubic hair) > unveiled the means of veiling

SW.content: if tekhnē never broke radically w/ physis—why reserve this animal naturality to woman? > woman weaves like a body secreting its own textile, like a worm, a worm w/out worm, a worm concerned to hide her non-being
SW.linkedContent: if tekhnē never broke radically w/ physis—why reserve this animal naturality to woman? > woman weaves like a body secreting its own textile, like a worm, a worm w/out worm, a worm concerned to hide her non-being

SW.content: for Freud (the Freud of Penismangel and pseudo-discovery of weaving), mother = matter = materia = Madeira = Holz = hylē
SW.linkedContent: for Freud (the Freud of Penismangel and pseudo-discovery of weaving), mother = matter = materia = Madeira = Holz = hylē

SW.content: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk, sperm, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)
SW.linkedContent: silkworm’s sex impossible to discern, the spitting outside oneself, secretion, of what will never leave it: female ejaculate, milk, sperm, fantasy of penis (neither veil, nor web)

RGE.content: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth
RGE.linkedContent: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth

RGE.content: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)
RGE.linkedContent: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)

RGE.content: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire
RGE.linkedContent: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire

REST.content: for Ferenczi, deviations (écarts) w/out essential norm [re: individual variants vs. universal symbols], supplements, overgarments, rain shoes, vaginas, sheath-effect
REST.linkedContent: for Ferenczi, deviations (écarts) w/out essential norm [re: individual variants vs. universal symbols], supplements, overgarments, rain shoes, vaginas, sheath-effect

REST.content: compare two shoes (not a pair) to gaine in Glas, sheath (garment) > bisexuality of the double in 2 shoes > displace sexual decidability, opposition btwn fetish & thing (castration as truth of truth)
REST.linkedContent: compare two shoes (not a pair) to gaine in Glas, sheath (garment) > bisexuality of the double in 2 shoes > displace sexual decidability, opposition btwn fetish & thing (castration as truth of truth)

REST.content: shoes sheath (gainent), to what profit, what sex? an undone stricture of laces, the girdle too, perhaps allows (donnerait) to be seen [Derrida quotes Balzac describing a naked, living, female foot protruding from a canvas—visitors médusés]
REST.linkedContent: shoes sheath (gainent), to what profit, what sex? an undone stricture of laces, the girdle too, perhaps allows (donnerait) to be seen [Derrida quotes Balzac describing a naked, living, female foot protruding from a canvas—visitors médusés]

PJP.content: Derrida is unable to reconstitute whole weave in which he cuts/selects—do not judge richness of Le Parjure from shreds extracted from it, in supplemental betrayal, for needs of current demonstration
PJP.linkedContent: Derrida is unable to reconstitute whole weave in which he cuts/selects—do not judge richness of Le Parjure from shreds extracted from it, in supplemental betrayal, for needs of current demonstration

D.content: violent, arbitrary cut, scission (la coupure) necessary because beginning se plie et se multiplie; coupe-papier (letter-opener), la lame (sharp blade) de la décision, tranchant (cutting edge); la répétition hasardeuse et nécessaire du déjà-là d’un (autre) texte
D.linkedContent: violent, arbitrary cut, scission (la coupure) necessary because beginning se plie et se multiplie; coupe-papier (letter-opener), la lame (sharp blade) de la décision, tranchant (cutting edge); la répétition hasardeuse et nécessaire du déjà-là d’un (autre) texte

D.content: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect
D.linkedContent: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect

D.content: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)
D.linkedContent: figure of quadrangle complicated by strange mirror [imparfait de double fond], mirror as echo that precedes origin it seems to answer > “echo” is an “incision” (X n’étant constitués qu’en retour)

D.content: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]
D.linkedContent: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]

D.content: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec
D.linkedContent: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec

+R.content: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)
+R.linkedContent: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)

+R.content: Ich [the painting, but…] can’t be found in Glas; Ich captures/draws to itself a psicultural machination rhythmed by logic of double band (bind) or so-called sheath (gaine) argument
+R.linkedContent: Ich [the painting, but…] can’t be found in Glas; Ich captures/draws to itself a psicultural machination rhythmed by logic of double band (bind) or so-called sheath (gaine) argument

+R.content: [quoting Glas] Genet’s text is not exhausted by the pocket Derrida cuts, sews, and binds: it was the text [Genet’s] which pierced a hole in the pocket first
+R.linkedContent: [quoting Glas] Genet’s text is not exhausted by the pocket Derrida cuts, sews, and binds: it was the text [Genet’s] which pierced a hole in the pocket first

C.content: royal weaver of paradigm in Plato’s Statesman

ATM.content: otherwise (autrement), the adverb in Otherwise than Being which wins out immeasurably over a verb, the beyond of the symplokē [linking nouns & verbs, that of essence], leaving a chain of traces, another symplokē [beyond essence]
ATM.linkedContent: otherwise (autrement), the adverb in Otherwise than Being which wins out immeasurably over a verb, the beyond of the symplokē [linking nouns & verbs, that of essence], leaving a chain of traces, another symplokē [beyond essence]

ATM.content: Levinas negotiates his negotiation w/ the unnegotiable in a way where he negotiates the negotiation (he reties the thread, weaves his interruptions of the same), to give the other a chance [Derrida refers to a double negation here], reprend dans sa toile l’histoire de toutes ses ruptures
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas negotiates his negotiation w/ the unnegotiable in a way where he negotiates the negotiation (he reties the thread, weaves his interruptions of the same), to give the other a chance [Derrida refers to a double negation here], reprend dans sa toile l’histoire de toutes ses ruptures

ATM.content: interruptive breakthrough occurs, ineluctable au moment même when Levinas’ philosophical récit claims to reappropriate the tear (déchirure) w/in the continuum of its (sa) texture
ATM.linkedContent: interruptive breakthrough occurs, ineluctable au moment même when Levinas’ philosophical récit claims to reappropriate the tear (déchirure) w/in the continuum of its (sa) texture

ATM.content: Levinas’ “en ce moment même” [of reappropriation] obligated by the second “en ce moment même” [of interruption] > forms a text w/ its own tear (déchirure), this “series” does not enclose the Other but opens itself up from out of irreducible difference—before any present moment
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas’ “en ce moment même” [of reappropriation] obligated by the second “en ce moment même” [of interruption] > forms a text w/ its own tear (déchirure), this “series” does not enclose the Other but opens itself up from out of irreducible difference—before any present moment

ATM.content: no tear (déchirure) possible in Levinas’ text w/out a certain notching (échancrure) of the 2nd moment, and certain contamination btwn the 2 > he likes the tear he detests contamination
ATM.linkedContent: no tear (déchirure) possible in Levinas’ text w/out a certain notching (échancrure) of the 2nd moment, and certain contamination btwn the 2 > he likes the tear he detests contamination

ATM.content: “metaphors” of seam and tear (couture et déchirure) obsess Levinas’ texts
ATM.linkedContent: “metaphors” of seam and tear (couture et déchirure) obsess Levinas’ texts

ATM.content: series (file, sequence, lineage…), seira (chord, chain, lasso…), sero (interlace, braid…), eirō ties interlacing of lace, the symplokē of discourse & the link
ATM.linkedContent: series (file, sequence, lineage…), seira (chord, chain, lasso…), sero (interlace, braid…), eirō ties interlacing of lace, the symplokē of discourse & the link

ATM.content: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage
ATM.linkedContent: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage

ATM.content: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language

ATM.content: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre
ATM.linkedContent: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre

LG.content: [all this due to Blanchot’s layering play w/ récit (recite, story, true account)] the other enunciates a decision: tears the toile (canvas, web) of a text as it envelops itself indefinitely in itself
LG.linkedContent: [all this due to Blanchot’s layering play w/ récit (recite, story, true account)] the other enunciates a decision: tears the toile (canvas, web) of a text as it envelops itself indefinitely in itself
